name: Gino Pollini
content:
Gino Pollini (19 January 1903 in Rovereto – 25 January 1991 in Milan) was an Italian architect.[1]
 In 1926 Pollini joined Gruppo 7, and from 1929 he worked in collaboration with another member of the group, Luigi Figini. Figini & Pollini had a long association with the Olivetti company from 1934 through 1957, designing many of their headquarters buildings at Ivrea.[2] He also taught architecture in Milan and Palermo.
 Pollini is the father of pianist Maurizio Pollini.
 Figini & Pollini, church of the Madonna dei Poveri, Milan (1952-54). Photo by Paolo Monti, 1960
 Figini & Pollini, Olivetti head offices in Ivrea. New ICO yards, reading room. Photo by Paolo Monti, 1960
 This article about an Italian architect or firm of architects is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.

Italian architect
This article relies largely or entirely on a single source. Relevant discussion may be found on the talk page. Please help improve this article by introducing citations to additional sources.Find sources: "Gino Pollini" – news · newspapers · books · scholar · JSTOR (January 2019)
 Olivetti building in Ivrea, designed by G.Pollini and L.Figini, 1955-1958
Gino Pollini (19 January 1903 in Rovereto – 25 January 1991 in Milan) was an Italian architect.[1]

Career[edit]
In 1926 Pollini joined Gruppo 7, and from 1929 he worked in collaboration with another member of the group, Luigi Figini. Figini & Pollini had a long association with the Olivetti company from 1934 through 1957, designing many of their headquarters buildings at Ivrea.[2] He also taught architecture in Milan and Palermo.
Pollini is the father of pianist Maurizio Pollini.





Figini & Pollini, church of the Madonna dei Poveri, Milan (1952-54). Photo by Paolo Monti, 1960






Figini & Pollini, Olivetti head offices in Ivrea. New ICO yards, reading room. Photo by Paolo Monti, 1960




References[edit]
